dict.acceptation: 通知；使活跃，使充满；预示；

sent.orig: From the very beginning, inform and counsel the parents, and protect their confidentiality.
sent.trans: 从发现病例起，就要通知病患父母和与其商议，并为他们保守秘密。

sent.orig: It fell to me to inform her of her son's death.
sent.trans: 要把她儿子死亡的消息告诉她，这责任落在了我的肩上。

sent.orig: Online games to inform and engage players about key issues confronting New York City.
sent.trans: 让玩家了解纽约面临的社会议题有哪些，并且参与其中的线上游戏。

sent.orig: Then he added, raising his voice, 'I grieve to inform the society--in secret.
sent.trans: 然后他放开了嗓门说，“我遗憾地转告诸位一一密号。”

sent.orig: He threatened to inform the government of his radical activities.
sent.trans: 他威胁说要向政府告发他的激进行为。
